intro: Eriope obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf eriope, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in dry, sandy soils. It is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops. Eriope obovata is a hardy perennial that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
